The myriad kinds return to their root, the thousand threads converge in darkness. Qi drifts like floating mist, blood rushes like flowing clarity. Alas, the portents of the body!

Thereafter, it is recorded in the cinnabar methods and ingestion formulas. The Southern Marchmount Perfected Person also said: Among my disciples who entered the chamber, there was the immortal Zhao Chengzi. When he first received my *Scripture of the Five Viscera’s Life-Securing*, he practiced it accordingly. Later, Chengzi wished to reenter the Great Yin to seek transformation of his appearance and form. He feigned death in the dark hills of Shanggu in Youzhou, beneath a stone chamber. Five years after his death, a mountain traveler saw his white bones in the chamber, his exposed skeleton lying in the dim room. Yet his five viscera remained intact within his abdomen, unrotted as before, their five-colored blossoms gleaming within. The mountain traveler sighed and said: "Of old, I heard that the five viscera could be nurtured to achieve imperishability. Now I behold one whose white bones bear blossoms within his chest—this man must have possessed the Dao but did not complete it, or perhaps failed some intermediate trial."

Thereupon, he reached out and parted the remains, seeing within the five viscera a white stone each, securing the five-colored blossoms in their proper places. The traveler said: "That your five viscera remain imperishable must be due to these five stones that generate the blossoms. You have already perished in the Dao; let me join you." He then took and swallowed them. Four or five years later, when Chengzi’s corpse was due to revive, the traveler, having already ingested the stones, found that on the morning of Chengzi’s revival, the five stones flew from his mouth like cicadas, accompanied by faint thunder. The five-colored brilliance pierced the sun as they returned directly to the viscera of the dead man. Thereby, Chengzi transformed his appearance and arose, as if from a single night’s drunken slumber. The traveler, his mind seized with terror and confusion, fell gravely ill. He entered the mountains to seek the place where the corpse had lain. Arriving before the stone chamber, he saw Chengzi reclining and whistling in the grotto. His face bore a jadelike glow, and he asked: "Who are you?"

Suddenly, five Elder Immortal Lords appeared, wearing brocade sashes and talismans, holding feathered tablets, their heads crowned with purple coronets. They addressed Chengzi, saying: "This is the man who stole and swallowed your five visceral treasure-stones." As soon as they spoke, the traveler’s face erupted with malignant sores, and he was struck dumb. By the time he returned home, the leprous ulcers had spread over his entire body. His entire household, young and old, died simultaneously, and his clan was thus extinguished.

It is also said that those who regularly ingest the essences of the sun and moon should frequently eat bamboo shoots. Bamboo shoots are the embryo of the sun’s radiance, also called Great Brilliance. They should also frequently eat the flesh of swans, which are the feathered birds of the moon’s embryo, also called Moon Herons. To ingest the sun and moon, one should consume these things, for their qi resonates and communicates.

The Perfected Person of the Great Void said: "Swan" is the general name for the feathered tribes. Magpies, geese, swans, and crows are all called "swan-herons." An ancient song says:
*"Swan-herons of a thousand years,
As viands they summon celestial perfected ones.
The Five Thearchs hold moon’s radiance in their beaks,
Seated in rows as guests in the empty sky."*
This is an ancient fisherman’s song.

The *Scripture of the Jade Dawn’s Luminous Mirror* says: Further, visualize the names of the five spirits, each seated securely in its palace. The five spirits all exhale purple qi, which coils around my body until inner and outer merge in darkness, and hands and feet are no longer visible.

Also visualize the sun and moon emerging from my cheeks—sun on the left, moon on the right—with their twofold radiance penetrating and illuminating. Thereupon, the purple qi suddenly clears. Gradually visualize the sun ascending and entering my mouth, which then consumes it, tasting like maltose. Swallow nine times and stop.

Also visualize the moon entering my navel, directly above the Gate of Destiny, its light descending to illuminate the Yin Chamber. Then visualize my hand grasping the handle of the Northern Dipper’s seven stars, wearing it as I walk. Enter the Purple Chamber within the Supreme Tenuity, and behold the Thearch, who says: "You have attained divine transcendence. I bestow upon you the Azure Jade Talisman, inscribed upon the heavens of the Nine Realms."

*"Within the coiled ninefold mystery,
Rising and sitting upon the clouds’ radiance,
The five talismans are entrusted to the Thearch’s son,
Who ascends and returns to the Flowering Infant."*

It further says:
*"The three and five oppose each other,
Heaven covers, earth begins.
I possess the five talismans,
Which ascend to the Thearch’s son.
The Three Non-abiding remain long,
Within the Chamber of the Celestial Camp."*
The above is from the *Scripture of the Five Elders and the Feminine One*.

The *Inner Chapters of the Mysterious Wondrous* says: The Supreme Lord said: The original Dao fundamentally arises from the Non-prior. It is the ancestor of the myriad qi, the origin of the myriad ways. Above the Void and Nothing, prior to Non-being, without form or image, neither existent nor non-existent, it is honored as having nothing above it, its nobility beyond compare.

The *Scripture of the Jade Dawn’s Luminous Mirror* says: The Scripture of the Cavern Realms of the Supreme One Thearch’s method for visualizing the five spirits also involves visualizing the spirits of the Supreme One, the Non-Brave, the White Prime, the Controller of Destiny, and the Peach Lord—altogether five female spirits—and nine male spirits, named the Three, Five, Nine, and Seven. When ascending to the Gate of Mystery, their forms and appearances all resemble those of newborn infants. The five females and nine males each exhale white qi from their mouths, mutually suffusing the practitioner’s body. Thereupon, the five females and nine males merge with the practitioner’s single body, blending into one. They become a single white qi, round in shape, resembling the sun’s radiant orb. In an instant, the round luminosity of the white qi transforms into two small children, one male and one female, both resembling newborn infants. The male is called the Perfected of the Nine Origins, the female is titled the Soul of the August One. The male is named Restraining Control, styled Three Yang; the female is named Ascending Return, styled Thearch’s Son.

chunks.original_text: 须臾又存男儿拘制，女儿上归，并立在日月之中，男在日中，女在月中，日月悬乎皇天，日在东方，月在西方，当时自觉一身乃已共化为向之白炁矣。 又存闻童子拘制在日中，有声咏曰：拘制三阳，九元之真，是我之号，日结我身，符籍玉清，与天相亲，混合雌雄，神仙缠绵。 又存闻上归女子在月中，有声咏曰：上归帝子，皇一之魂，是我之号，月结我精，主人符籍，已在大明，与玄为亲，寿万亿龄，混合雌雄，裸身华。 《汉武内传》曰：西王母授帝《五岳真形图灵光生经》，上元夫人授帝《六甲灵飞招真》十二事，云云。 或乘虚步玄之术，诸要妙辞，帝自撰集为一卷，及所受之事，皆承以黄金之几，封以白玉之函，以珊瑚为床，紫锦为囊，安着□梁台上，数自朝拜，烧香洒扫，帝后意旨自误，不修至戒，每事不从王母之言，王母遂不复来。 太初无年天火烧□梁台，所受十二事於是烧失矣。 《化形隐景登升保仙上经》曰：存九晨帝君隐妃九阴内名，形色衣服，皆使朗然从北斗来，下炎流映，焕烂虚无，回神玄映，入我身中。 九晨即九星之精也。 《紫度炎光经》说同也。 《真诰》曰：南岳夫人言《宝神经》是裴清灵锦囊中书，侍者常所带者，裴昔从紫微夫人受此书也，吾亦有俱如此写西宫中定本。 又问西宫所在，答云：是玄圃北坛西瑶之上台也，天真宝文尽藏於此中。 裴真人又言此尽与隐尽同辈事要，而即可得用，一名七隐玄书。 《真诰》曰：六月二十四日夜，紫微王夫人来降，因下地请问真灵云云，敢谘於此，愿诲曚昧。 夫人因令复坐，即见□令书，此以答曰：夫泛景虚玄，无涂可寻，言发空中，无物可纵，云云。 是故放荡元津，遂任风鼓枻，存乎虚舟而行耳，故实中之空，有中之无象矣，至於书迹之示，则挥於纸札云云。 骞露有骸之物，而得与世进退，上玷逸真之咏，下亏有隔之禁，亦我等所不行，灵法所不许也。 请陈为书之本始也。 造化之既肇矣，乃是五色初萌，文章尽定之秀，人民之交别，阴阳之分判，有三元八会群方飞天之书，又有八龙灵篆明光之章也，其后逮三皇之世，演八会之文，为龙凤之章，拘省云篆之迹，以为顺形梵书，分破二道，坏真从易，配别本支，乃为六十四种之书也，遂播之于三十六天十方上下也，云云。 校而论之，八会之书是书之至真，建文章之祖也，今三元八会之书，玉帝太极高真诸仙之所用也，云篆明章，今所见神灵符书之字是也。 《真诰》曰：南岳夫人语弟子，言我明日当诣王屋山清虚宫，令汝知之所至也。 《真诰》曰：紫清真妃坐良久，都不言，妃手中先握三枚枣，色如乾枣而形长，内无核，亦不作枣味，有似於梨味耳，妃先以一枚见与，次以一枚与紫微夫人，自留一枚，令各食毕，真妃问年登答，云云。 真妃又曰：君师南真夫人，司命秉权，道高妙备，寔良德之宗也。 《真诰》曰：六月二十六日夜，降八真人，紫微左夫人，紫清上宫九华真妃二，上真司命南岳夫人三，紫阳真人四，清灵真人五，茅中君六，茅小君七。 又有一神，甚少整顿，建芙蓉冠，朱衣带剑，未曾见也，隐疑是桐□山真人王子乔。 多论金庭山中事，言多有不可解者，恭玄紫微上真九华妃也，皆揖称也。

The *Inner Transmission of Emperor Wu of Han* states: The Queen Mother of the West bestowed upon the Emperor the *Illuminated Scripture of the Five Marchmounts’ True Forms*, while the Lady of the Supreme Prime granted him the *Twelve Methods of the Six Jia Spirit-Flight Summoning the Perfected*, and so forth. The *Declarations of the Perfected* states: The Lady of South Marchmount said that the *Scripture of Treasuring the Spirit* was a text from the brocade pouch of Pei Qingling, which her attendants always carried. Pei had once received this scripture from the Lady of Purple Tenuity, and I also possess a copy transcribed in the Western Palace’s definitive edition.

The *Declarations of the Perfected* states: On the night of the twenty-fourth day of the sixth month, the Lady of Purple Tenuity, Queen Wang, descended and came to earth, whereupon she was asked about the clouds of true numina. Humbly seeking instruction in these obscure matters, she was bidden to sit again. Then, □ commanded the writing of this response:

no path can be traced.
Words uttered in the void,
nothing to grasp.
Thus, unbound by the primal stream,
one surrenders to the wind’s oar.
Abiding in the empty boat,
one travels—
hence, the emptiness within the real,
the formlessness within being.

Divided and broken, the true was corrupted for the sake of ease, branches were matched to roots, and thus arose the sixty-four kinds of writing. These were then disseminated throughout the thirty-six heavens and the ten directions above and below.

Upon examination, the *Eight Meetings* are the most authentic of writings, the ancestors of literary composition. Today, the *Scriptures of the Three Origins and Eight Meetings* are used by the Jade Thearch, the Supreme Ultimate, and the various perfected immortals. The *Luminous Chapters of Cloud Seal-Script* are the characters seen in the talismanic writings of gods and spirits.

chunks.original_text: 官上真云，昨与叔申诣清虚宫，校为真仙得失之事耳，近顿除落四十七人，都复上三人耳，并复视尔辈之名简，如今佳耳，许某及得在伯扎中，许某即长史名。 日者霞之实，霞者日之精，君虽闻服日实之法，未见知餐霞之精也。 夫餐霞之经甚秘，致霞之道甚易，此谓体生玉光，霞映上清之法也。 眼者身之镜，耳者体之牖，视多则镜昏，听众则牖暗，妾有磨镜之石，决牖之术，即能彻洞万灵，眇察绝响，可乎。 《真诰》曰：阆野者，阆风之府是也。 昆仑上有九府，是为九宫，太极为太宫也。 诸仙人但是九官之官僚耳，至於真人，乃九宫之公卿。 夫仙官有上下，各有次秩，仙有左右府，而有左右公、左右卿、左右大夫、左右御史也。 明大洞为仙卿，服金丹为大夫，服芝为御史，若得太极隐芝服之，便为左仙公及真人矣。 真人告曰：人随俗要求华名，譬若烧香，众人皆闻其芳，然不知熏，自以燔焰尽则炁灭，名立则身绝，是故高人哂而远之，遂为清净。 又曰：有似骋冰车之陆乎炎州，泛火舟以浪於溺津矣。 自非真正，亦失者万万。

The Perfected of the Upper Offices said: "Yesterday, I went with Shu Shen to the Palace of Pure Vacuity to examine the successes and failures of those who have attained true transcendence. Recently, forty-seven were abruptly removed, and only three were restored to the registers. We also reviewed the name-slips of your cohort—now things are well. Xu [so-and-so] is included among the *bozha*, and Xu [so-and-so] is the name of the Chief Scribe.

The fruit of the rosy clouds is the essence of the sun, and the rosy clouds are the radiance of the sun. Though you have heard of the method of ingesting the sun’s fruit, you have not yet known the art of consuming the rosy clouds’ essence. The scriptures on consuming rosy clouds are most secret, yet the way to summon them is quite simple—this is the method of embodying jade-light and reflecting the rosy clouds of the Upper Clarity.

The eyes are the body’s mirrors, and the ears are the body’s windows. Too much seeing dims the mirror, and too much hearing darkens the windows. I possess the whetstone to polish mirrors and the technique to unseal windows—with these, you may penetrate the myriad spirits and perceive the faintest echoes. Is this acceptable?"

The *Zhen’gao* states: "The Wilds of Lang are the precincts of Langfeng. Atop Kunlun lie the Nine Offices, which are the Nine Palaces, with the Great Ultimate as the Grand Palace. All immortals are merely the functionaries of the Nine Palaces, while the Perfected are the dukes and ministers of the Nine Palaces.

The offices of transcendents have ranks, each with its proper order. There are left and right bureaus of transcendents, with left and right dukes, left and right ministers, left and right grand masters, and left and right censors. Those who master the Great Cavern are the ministers of transcendents; those who ingest golden elixirs are the grand masters; those who consume magic mushrooms are the censors. If one obtains and consumes the Hidden Mushroom of the Great Ultimate, one becomes the Left Duke of Transcendents and a Perfected.

The Perfected said: "People follow worldly customs in seeking vain reputations—it is like burning incense: though many smell its fragrance, they do not know that the smoke, once its flame is spent, disperses and vanishes. When fame is established, the person perishes. Thus, the lofty withdraw and remain in purity."

They also said: "It is like racing an ice-chariot across the fiery lands of the south or sailing a fire-boat upon drowning waters. Without true rectitude, failure is certain in ten thousand cases out of ten thousand."

chunks.original_text: 《真诰》曰：张姜子等先在第二等中，亦始得入易迁耳，易迁童初二宫，是男女之道堂馆也，其中闲静，东海青君一年再游，校此诸宫，观见群辈也。 赵素台，在易迁中已四百年，不肯徙，自谓天下无复乐此处也。 素台，赵熙之女，熙汉时为幽州刺史，有济穷人於河中，救玉惠等於族诛，行阴德数十事，故其身得诣朱陵，其儿子今并得在洞天中也，熙常出入定录府。 易迁中有高业而萧条者，有窦琼英、韩太华、刘春龙、王进贤、李奚子、郭叔香，此数人并天姿郁秀，澄尚眇邈，才及拟胜，仪观骇众，此即主者之高者，仙官之可才，其次及得张姜子辈，邓伯苗母有善行，故后来人多宗庇之。 窦琼英者，窦武之妹也，七世祖有名峙者，以藏枯骨活死为事，故祚及於英身矣。 韩太华者，安国妹，汉二师将军李广利之妇，利宿世有功德，利今亦在宫受化。 刘春龙者，汉宗正刘奉先之女。 李奚子者，李忠之祖母也，忠晋东平太守，忠祖父云云，多行阴德，尝天大雪寒，常露谷於园庭，恐鸟饿死，其用心如此。 王进贤，王衍女也。 事许长史。

*The Declarations of the Perfected* states: Zhang Jiangzi and others were initially ranked in the second grade, having only just entered the Palace of Easy Transitions. The Palace of Easy Transitions and the Youthful Prime Palace are the halls and chambers of the Dao of man and woman. Within them, all is serene and tranquil. The Azure Lord of the Eastern Sea visits twice a year, inspecting these palaces and observing the assembled multitudes.

Zhao Sutai has dwelled in the Palace of Easy Transitions for four hundred years and refuses to move, declaring that nowhere in the world brings greater joy than this place. Sutai was the daughter of Zhao Xi, who served as Inspector of Youzhou during the Han. Xi aided the destitute in the Yellow River, rescued Yu Hui and others from the execution of their clans, and performed countless acts of hidden virtue. Thus, he himself attained the Vermilion Mound, and his descendants now dwell in the Grotto-Heavens. Xi frequently enters and exits the Palace of the Register of Destinies.

Among those in the Palace of Easy Transitions who have attained lofty merit yet remain in quiet obscurity are Dou Qiongying, Han Taihua, Liu Chunlong, Wang Jinxian, Li Xizi, and Guo Shuxiang. These individuals possess natures of dense elegance, their aspirations pure and distant, their talents surpassing all comparison, their bearing awe-inspiring to the multitude. They are the most exalted among the stewards, the most capable among the transcendents’ officials. Those of the next rank include Zhang Jiangzi and her peers. Deng Boniao’s mother performed many virtuous deeds, and thus later arrivals often seek her patronage and protection.

Dou Qiongying was the younger sister of Dou Wu. Her seventh-generation ancestor, a man named Zhi, made it his life’s work to gather dry bones and restore the dead to life. Thus, his blessings extended to Qiongying’s own lifetime.

Han Taihua was the younger sister of Han Anguo and the wife of Li Guangli, the Han general of the Second Campaign against Dayuan. Guangli had accumulated merit and virtue in past lives, and he now resides in the palace undergoing transformation.

Liu Chunlong was the daughter of Liu Fengxian, the Han Minister of the Imperial Clan.

Li Xizi was the grandmother of Li Zhong, who served as Grand Administrator of Dongping during the Jin. Zhong’s grandfather (and others) performed many acts of hidden virtue. Once, during a great snowstorm, he scattered grain in the garden courtyard, fearing the birds would starve. Such was the depth of his compassion.

Wang Jinxian was the daughter of Wang Yan.

chunks.original_text: 郭叔香者，王修母也。 王修字叔治，北海人，魏武郎中令，年七岁丧母，母以社日亡，不知是郭谁也。 其童初府有王少道、范叔胜、李伯山，皆童初府之标者。 《真诰》曰：郎宗，字仲绥，北海安丘人，少仕官为吴县令，学精道术，占候风炁，后一旦有暴风经窗间，占知京师大火烧大夏门，遣人往参果尔，诸公闻之，以博士征宗，耻以占候就征，夜解印绶负笈遁去，居华山下，服胡麻丸得道，今在洞中。 又有朱□者，陈留人也，为人无道，专作劫盗，后人发觉云云。 远遁他境，至汝南少室山中，见冯先生隐学云云，后三年乃授其真道，留山服食，修道三十八年，后入东坑山中，寿百四十七岁，仙人降，将入大有山洞中成真人。 又有郭静者，颖川人也，少孤云云。 年十六县召为吏，后得下罪逃伏，经二月不出，遇见郑先生云云。 静遂随郑驱使，经七年不敢懈怠，遂授其导引之要，饵服山木、茯苓，得寿三百年，后於天维山中赤松子降授其二人真道，今在大有洞中为真人。 又曰：司马季主后入委羽山石室大有宫中，受石精金光藏景化形法於西灵子都，子都者，太玄仙女也。 其同时今在大有室中者，广宁鲍叔阳，太原王伯养，颖川刘伟惠、代郡段季正，俱受师西灵子都之道也。 季主临去之际，托形枕席为代己之象，墓在蜀郡成都升盘山之南，诸葛武侯昔建碑铭德於季主墓前，碑赞末曰：玄漠太寂，混合阴阳，天地交泮，万品滋彰。 先生理蓍，分别柔刚，鬼神以观，六度显明。 季主颜如少女，髭鬓三天，其黑如墨。

Guo Shuxiang was the mother of Wang Xiu. Wang Xiu, styled Shuzhi, was a native of Beihai. During the Wei, he served as Cavalier Attendant-in-Ordinary to the Martial Emperor. At the age of seven, he lost his mother, who passed away on the day of the She Festival. It was not known to whom among the Guos she belonged.

In his youth, the prefectural office had Wang Shaodao, Fan Shusheng, and Li Boshan, all paragons of the prefectural office in their youth.

The *True Records* states: Lang Zong, styled Zhongsui, was a native of Anqiu in Beihai. In his early years, he served as Magistrate of Wu County. His studies delved deeply into the Daoist arts, and he was skilled in divining the winds and qi. One day, a sudden gale swept through his window. Upon divination, he knew that a great fire would burn the Great Xia Gate in the capital. He sent someone to verify, and indeed, it was so. When the various lords heard of this, they summoned Zong as a Academician. Ashamed to be summoned for his divination skills, he removed his official seal and sash by night, shouldered his satchel, and fled. He dwelled beneath Mount Hua, ingested sesame pills, and attained the Dao. He now resides within the grotto.

There was also Zhu [missing character], a native of Chenliu. He was a man without the Way, devoted solely to robbery and banditry. Later, when his crimes were discovered, he fled far away to another region. Arriving at Mount Shaoshi in Runan, he encountered Master Feng, who lived in reclusion and studied the Dao. After three years, he was transmitted the true Dao. Remaining on the mountain to ingest herbs and cultivate the Way for thirty-eight years, he later entered Mount Dongkeng. At the age of one hundred and forty-seven, immortals descended and led him into the grotto of Mount Dayou, where he became a perfected one.

There was also Guo Jing, a native of Yingchuan. Orphaned in his youth, at the age of sixteen, he was summoned by the county to serve as an official. Later, he committed a minor offense and fled into hiding, remaining secluded for two months. He then encountered Master Zheng. Jing thereafter followed Zheng, serving him for seven years without敢懈怠. He was transmitted the essentials of guiding and pulling, ingested mountain herbs and *fuling*, and attained a lifespan of three hundred years. Later, in Mount Tianwei, Master Red Pine descended and transmitted to the two of them the true Dao. They now reside in the grotto of Mount Dayou as perfected ones.

It further states: Sima Jizhu later entered the stone chamber of the Dayou Palace in Mount Weiyu, where he received from Xiling Zidu the method of "Concealing the Radiance and Transforming the Form with Stone Essence and Golden Light." Zidu was a transcendent maiden of the Great Mystery. Those who, in the same era, now reside in the Dayou chamber include Bao Shuyang of Guangning, Wang Boyang of Taiyuan, Liu Weihui of Yingchuan, and Duan Jizheng of Daijun, all of whom received the Way from their master, Xiling Zidu.

As Jizhu was about to depart, he left behind his form upon the pillow and mat as a likeness to replace himself. His tomb lies south of Mount Shengpan in Chengdu of Shu Commandery. In former times, Marquis Wu of Shu, Zhuge Liang, erected a stele before Jizhu’s tomb to inscribe his virtue. At the end of the stele’s eulogy, it reads:

The profound desert, the great stillness,
Merging yin and yang,
Heaven and earth intermingle,
Myriad beings flourish and manifest.
The master ordered the milfoil,
Distinguishing the soft and hard.
Spirits and gods beheld,
The Six Perfections shone clearly.

Jizhu’s complexion was like that of a young maiden, his beard and sideburns those of the Three Heavens, black as ink.

chunks.original_text: 男女二人各令修道，男名汝育，女名济华，今皆在委羽山中，济华今日正读三十九章，犹未过竟。 《裴君序诀》曰：裴君字玄仁，少为人颜仪整素，目有精光，垂臂下膝，声气高彻，呼如锺鸣。 《真诰》曰：火枣交梨之树在君心中也，今心中犹有荆棘相杂，是以二树不见，不审可剪荆棘出树否，此树单生，其几好也。 《登真隐诀》曰：太微造形紫元内神二十四人，生气变神，主仙上精，能修存名字者，治镇一身，保守元精，紫虚并结气之玄宗，成体之具神，连导云雾，带生真烟，各能致玉辇龙骑，千万列行，同舆一体，白日登晨，此大真人乘飙欻之道，行之十八年，太上命太微混灵道君，檄二十四真人，千乘万骑，驰风蹑云，呼吸流升，白日造天注内。 案《三一经》云：太微中有二十四气，气中有二十四真人，皆帝皇之臣，所以致分道变化矣。 既致守身中三一，则上太微三一，帝皇之君而降见於外，与子言矣，皆出入上清，寝止太微，案如此言，令守身中三部，亦能致彼二十四真，千乘万骑而来迎也。 入日左龙名飙精，右龙名欻亭，存二龙并吐白烟，非止己身之神真，能腾跃玄霄矣。 《葛仙公内传》曰：从叔孝先曰：卿迈俗味，奔华道，慕神仙，乃巢绮之上真佳事也。 上清仙府琼林经竟 #1『诣』原本误作『请』，据文义改。 #2『京』字据文义补。 #3『曰』字据文义补。 #4『声』字据文义补。 #5『仙』字据文义补。

The *Preface to the Formulae of Master Pei* states: Master Pei, styled Xuanren, was dignified and unadorned in his youthful appearance. His eyes shone with a luminous essence, his arms hung past his knees, and his voice was resonant and clear, ringing like a struck bell.

The *True Reports* says: The trees of fire-jujubes and intersecting pears grow within your heart. Yet now, thorns and brambles are tangled among them, which is why the two trees remain unseen. I wonder if one might prune the brambles to reveal the trees—these trees grow alone, and how fine they would be!

The *Hidden Formulae for Ascending Perfection* states: Within the Purple Prime of the Grand Tenuity dwell twenty-four inner spirits, born of generative qi and transformed into numinous beings. They govern the essence of transcendence. Those who cultivate and invoke their names will govern and guard the primordial essence of the body. The Purple Void unites with the mysterious origin of conjoined qi, forming the vessel of embodied spirit. They guide clouds and mist, gird themselves with the true smoke of life, and each may summon jade chariots and dragon-riders, arrayed in ranks of thousands. Together, they ascend as one, mounting the dawn in broad daylight. This is the Way of the Great Perfected, who ride the whirlwind and vanish in an instant. After eighteen years of practice, the Most High commanded the Lord of the Grand Tenuity and Blended Numinosity to dispatch the twenty-four perfected ones. With a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, they galloped upon the wind and trod the clouds, inhaling and exhaling to ascend in flowing ascent, entering the celestial registers in broad daylight.

According to the *Scripture of the Three Ones*: Within the Grand Tenuity dwell twenty-four qi, and within each qi resides a perfected one, all ministers of the Thearchs. Through them, the Dao achieves its manifold transformations.

Once one has attained the Three Ones within the body, the Three Ones of the Grand Tenuity—the Lords of the Thearchs—will descend and manifest externally, speaking with you. They come and go from the Supreme Clarity, resting within the Grand Tenuity. As this text states, by guarding the Three Sections within the body, one may also summon those twenty-four perfected ones, who will arrive with a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders to welcome you.

The dragon on the left of the sun is named Whirlwind Essence, and the dragon on the right is named Vanishing Pavilion. Visualize the two dragons exhaling white mist, and not only will your own spirit-perfected ones ascend the mysterious heavens.

The *Inner Biography of Lord Ge the Immortal* records: My uncle, Xiaoxian, said, “You have transcended worldly tastes, forsaken splendor for the Dao, and aspired to immortality—this is the noble pursuit of the loftiest perfected ones.”

The *Jade Grove Scripture of the Supreme Clarity’s Immortal Courts* is now complete.
